Posts.Title: Sentinol Node Biopsy bemurray ADK

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2009 08:11AM bemurray wrote: Hi Kelty, I was just diagnosed last week and am awaiting my next steps - scared of the unknown right now and my mind is getting the better of me - thinking the worst.  I go to meet with the surgeon and oncologist tomorrow and want to start my treatments or get my surgery scheduled ASAP - I am so scared of if/where the spread is that my anxiety is making me sick.  I also have a 4 yr old and will do anything to stay alive to be with her - its funny how un-important everything else has become.  Thank you to all you women who have beat this - we need to hear your success stories to keep the faith.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed 3 months after giving birth to my second child kelty kelty

Posts.Content: May 21, 2009 09:58AM bemurray wrote: Best of Luck  - I am doing a nipple sparing with Implants with Alloderm next Thursday in Boston.  My surgeon who has not done these yet but has asked a lead surgeon from another hospital to mentor her in the operating room.  Keep looking for someone or come on out to Boston......  I met with the plastic surgeon yesterday who said this is the direction mastectomies will be going in the future (for good candidates).
Posts.Title: Nipple Sparing Alloderm w/Implant Breast Reconstruction brynze clemmons64

Posts.Content: bemurray wrote: I am 39 years old, no family history of cancer and I was diagnosed 2 weeks ago - its been the longest 2 weeks of my life.  I have a 1cm tumor and have been awaiting my surgery date for lumpectomy.  Had an MRI and they see another "area of enhancement". My doctor will not schedule surgery until they biopsy the other area but it cannot be seen by ultrasound to biopsy it.  I am now waiting for a date to have an "operation" to do a biopsy via MRI.  If this other area is cancer I lost my chance for lumpectomy.  Has anyone had this type of an MRI before and what do they do?  Beth Beth Dx 1/28/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Has anyone had a MRI guided biopsy bemurray Trickling

Posts.Content: bemurray wrote: I am having a lumpectomy and SNB done in 2 weeks.  For the SNB do they just biopsy or do they take out nodes and if so how many? Beth Dx 1/28/2009, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/0 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2009 11:47AM bemurray wrote: Thank you so much for all your responses - Pam - please let me know how it goes.  I did have a ultrasound biopsy on my first lump - bled like crazy but it was bearable.  My "area of enhancement" is in the same breast.  Let me know your experience so I can prepare myself please.
